If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

My C# code:
```
using Newtonsoft.Json.Linq;

[CmdletAttribute("Set", "Json")]
public class SetJsonCmdlet : Cmdlet {
  protected override void ProcessRecord() {
    System.Diagnostics.Process.Start("/bin/vim", "/home/nutanix/asdf");
  }
}
```

Makefile:
```
mcs -target:library -out:a.dll -reference:$(DEPS_DIR)/Newtonsoft.Json.10.0.3/lib/net40/Newtonsoft.Json.dll
```

Compile using `make`

Then in powershell, I run: 
```powershell
Import-Module ./a.dll
Set-Json
```

How to install Newtonsoft.Json dependency: `nuget install -OutputDirectory deps Newtonsoft.Json -Version 10.0.3`

Expected behavior
-----------------

Should open up vim editor cleanly.

Actual behavior
---------------

It looks like both powershell and vim are outputting chars to stdout? It's screwed up for sure.

Environment data
----------------

